item.title: When part of a coastal cliff collapsed on Saturday, luckily no one was hurt. Thatâ€™s because the rock...
item.description:
ğŸ¦ @TimesofIsrael

When part of a coastal cliff collapsed on Saturday, luckily no one was hurt. Thatâ€™s because the rockfall occurred at Sidna Ali beach in central Herzliya, which the local council had already closed to the public after the government neglected for years to fund repairs. Israel has 45 kilometers (28 miles) of soft kurkar cliffs, of which 22 kilometers (13.7 miles) have been earmarked for strengthening, as they overlook public beaches.
